interfaces
Class BriansBrain

java.lang.Object
  interfaces.RuleAbstract
      interfaces.BriansBrain
All Implemented Interfaces:
Rule
public class BriansBrain
extends RuleAbstract

Author:
Gautham Nagaraju, Prakhar Dubey, Victor Dong, Akash Kulkarni The Class implements the rules involved with Brian's Brain automaton. It consists of an infinite two-dimensional grid of cells, each cell may be in one of three states: on, dying, or off. Each cell is considered to have eight neighbors (Moore neighborhood). In each time step, a cell turns on if it was off but had exactly two neighbors that were on. All cells that were on go into the dying state, which is not counted as an "on" cell in the neighbor count, and prevents any cell from being born there. Cells that were in the dying state go into the off state.
